name: Min. Eff. Res. Elec. WH (FS)
_description: Represents switch to electric residential WH technologies with efficiency levels determined by a sales-weighted average of the efficiencies/costs of typical electric residential WH technologies currently (or soon to be) on the market, from AEO 2023

market_entry_year_source.notes: Assume historical measure penetration is captured in baseline

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Sales-weighted combinations of WH efficiencies for typical 2022 HPWH (3.33 UEF) and electric resistance storage (0.92) WH. New/replacement sales numbers for 2023 are drawn from AEO 2023 microdata files, (~82% resistance, ~18% HPWH in 2023 across all sales), available from EIA upon request. Additional performance impacts for this measure relative to the typical electric equipment are accounted for via the savings shape data in `tsv_features`

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

installed_cost_source.notes: Sales-weighted combinations of WH efficiencies for typical 2022 HPWH and electric resistance storage WH. New/replacement sales numbers drawn from AEO microdata files, available from EIA upon request. Also added $700, the upper bound of the upgrade/new branch circuit cost in NV5 report

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
Service Upgrades for Electrification Retrofits Study Final Report
source_data.author: Shoshana Pena, Collin Smith, Greg Butsko, Rick Gardner, Sean Armstrong, Emily Higbee, Dylan Anderson, Rebecca Hueckel

product_lifetime_source.notes: Sales-weighted combinations of WH efficiencies for typical 2022 HPWH and electric resistance storage WH. New/replacement sales numbers drawn from AEO microdata files, available from EIA upon request.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
